rpg.item

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • rpg.item.ItemImplementation
      • rpg.item.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Item

    public class Weapon
extends ItemImplementation
    A Weapon is a special type of ItemImplementation involving additionally a damage
    Author:
    Mathias, Frederic

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Weapon(Weight weight, int damage)
      Initializes this weapon with the given weight and damage.
      Weapon(Weight weight, int damage, int value)
      Initializes this weapon with the given weight, parent, damage and value.

      • isValidMaxDamage

        public static boolean isValidMaxDamage(int maxDamage)
        Checks whether the given maximum damage is a valid maximum damage.
        Parameters:
        maxDamage - The maximum damage to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given maximum damage is greater then or equal to 1. | result == ( maxDamage >= 1 )

      • hasValidMaxDamage

        @Raw
public boolean hasValidMaxDamage()
        Checks whether the maximum damage is valid.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the maximum damage is a valid maximum damage. | result == isValidMaxDamage( getMaxDamage() )

      • isValidDamage

        public static boolean isValidDamage(int damage)
        Checks whether the given damage is valid.
        Parameters:
        damage - The damage to check
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given damage is a multiple of 7 and the given damage is less than or equal to the maximum damage and the given damage is more than or equal to 1. | result == ((damage % 7 == 0) && (damage <= getMaxDamage()) && (damage >= 1))

      • hasValidDamage

        @Raw
public boolean hasValidDamage()
        Checks whether the damage of this weapon is valid.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the damage of this weapon is a valid damage. | result == isValidDamage(getDamage())

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Description copied from interface: Item
        Return the value of this item
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Item
        Overrides:
        getValue in class ItemImplementation
        Returns:
        If use formula is true the value is equal to the product of the damage of this weapon and the damage value factor. | if(getUseFormula()) | result == ( getDamageValueFactor()*getDamage() ) Otherwise the result is the value of this weapon. | else then | result == super.getValue()
        See Also:
        Item

      • canHaveAsValue

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsValue(int value)
        Checks whether the given value is a valid value for this weapon.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsValue in interface Item
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsValue in class ItemImplementation
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given value is between 1 and 200 | result == ( (value >= 1) && (value <= 200) )
        See Also:
        Item
